properties.question: Where is the Rani ki Vav (Stepwell) located?
properties.brief: Built in 1063 CE; a UNESCO site representing the Solanki dynasty's peak.

properties.question: When was the First Battle of Tarain fought?
properties.brief: Near Thanesar; Prithviraj Chauhan defeated Muhammad Ghori.

properties.question: Where did the Slave Dynasty founder establish his first capital?
properties.brief: 1206 CE; Qutubuddin Aibak founded the Mamluk Sultanate here.

properties.question: When did Iltutmish receive the investiture from the Caliph of Baghdad?
properties.brief: Formalized the Delhi Sultanate as a legal independent entity.

properties.question: Where is the Brihadisvara Temple built by Rajaraja I?
properties.brief: Completed in 1010 CE; a masterpiece of Chola granite architecture.

properties.question: When did Marco Polo visit the Kakatiya Kingdom?
properties.brief: He described the prosperity of the port of Motupalli.

properties.question: Where did Alauddin Khalji lead the 1303 siege against the Guhila rulers?
properties.brief: 1303 CE; led to the legendary Jauhar of Rani Padmini.

properties.question: When did Ghiyasuddin Tughlaq found the Tughlaq Dynasty?
properties.brief: Followed the end of the Khalji Dynasty; he built the Tughlaqabad Fort.

properties.question: Where did Muhammad bin Tughlaq shift the capital from Delhi?
properties.brief: 1327 CE; attempt to centralize administration in the Deccan.

properties.question: When was the Vijayanagara Empire founded?
properties.brief: Established by Harihara and Bukka on the Tungabhadra River.

properties.question: Where was the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire located?
properties.brief: Destroyed in 1565; currently a sprawling UNESCO World Heritage site.

properties.question: When did the Bahmani Kingdom break away from the Sultanate?
properties.brief: Founded by Hasan Gangu; the first independent Muslim state in the Deccan.

properties.question: Where did Timur (Tamerlane) cause massive destruction in 1398?
properties.brief: 1398 CE; his invasion effectively ended the power of the Tughlaq Sultans.

properties.question: When did the Persian traveler Abdur Razzaq visit the South?
properties.brief: He visited during the reign of Deva Raya II of Vijayanagara.

properties.question: Where did Rao Jodha establish his capital in 1459?
properties.brief: 1459 CE; the seat of the Rathore clan of Marwar.

properties.question: When did the Lodi Dynasty begin?
properties.brief: Founded by Bahlul Lodi; the first Afghan dynasty of the Delhi Sultanate.

properties.question: Where did Mahmud Begada establish his secondary capital?
properties.brief: Built in the late 15th century; a blend of Hindu and Islamic architecture.

properties.question: When did Vasco da Gama arrive in Calicut?
properties.brief: Marked the beginning of direct European maritime trade with India.

properties.question: Where did the Portuguese establish their primary enclave in 1510?
properties.brief: 1510 CE; conquered from the Bijapur Sultanate by Albuquerque.

properties.question: When did the Battle of Khanwa take place?
properties.brief: Babur defeated the Rajput confederacy led by Rana Sanga.

properties.question: When was the First Battle of Panipat fought?
properties.brief: Establishment of the Mughal Empire; Babur defeated Ibrahim Lodi.

properties.question: Where is the mausoleum of Sher Shah Suri?
properties.brief: 1545 CE; an architectural masterpiece in the middle of a lake.

properties.question: When was the Second Battle of Panipat fought?
properties.brief: Akbar's forces under Bairam Khan defeated the forces of Hemu.

properties.question: Where did Akbar build the Ibadat Khana for religious discussion?
properties.brief: 1575 CE; where Akbar discussed theology with various religious leaders.

properties.question: When was the Battle of Talikota fought?
properties.brief: The decisive defeat of Vijayanagara by the Deccan Sultanates.

properties.question: Where did Maharana Pratap fight the Mughal army led by Man Singh?
properties.brief: 1576 CE; one of the most famous battles in Rajput history.

properties.question: When was the Mansabdari system organized by Akbar?
properties.brief: The unique military-administrative system of the Mughals.

properties.question: Where is the Charminar located?
properties.brief: 1591 CE; built by the Qutb Shahi dynasty to mark the city's founding.

properties.question: When did Sir Thomas Roe reach Jahangir's court?
properties.brief: He secured official trading rights for the East India Company.

properties.question: Where is the tomb of Itmad-ud-Daula located?
properties.brief: 1622 CE; first Mughal building to extensively use marble and pietra dura.

properties.question: When was the Taj Mahal completed?
properties.brief: Shah Jahan's tribute to Mumtaz Mahal; took over 20 years to build.

properties.question: Where was the coronation of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj?
properties.brief: 1674 CE; marks the formal birth of the Maratha Kingdom.

properties.question: When did Aurangzeb re-impose the Jizya tax?
properties.brief: A policy that intensified regional resistance against Mughal rule.

properties.question: Where was the capital of the Qutb Shahi dynasty captured in 1687?
properties.brief: 1687 CE; the fortress fell to Aurangzeb after an 8-month siege.

properties.question: When was the Khalsa Panth founded?
properties.brief: Guru Gobind Singh established the Sikh warrior code at Anandpur Sahib.

properties.question: Where is the Bibi Ka Maqbara located?
properties.brief: Built in 1660 CE; known as the Taj of the Deccan.

properties.question: When did the Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb die?
properties.brief: His death in Ahmednagar led to the slow disintegration of the empire.

properties.question: Where is the site of the Battle of Chappar Chiri?
properties.brief: 1710 CE; Banda Singh Bahadur defeated the Mughal Governor Wazir Khan.

properties.question: When did Nadir Shah invade Delhi?
properties.brief: He took the Peacock Throne and Koh-i-Noor diamond back to Persia.

properties.question: Where did Lachit Borphukan defeat the Mughals?
properties.brief: 1671 CE; the Ahom army secured the independence of the Brahmaputra valley.
